p: Cistus ladanifer secretes a large amount of exudate from its leaves and photosynthetic stems through trichomes. This exudate is characterised by two families of secondary metabolites, flavonoids and diterpenoids [ 17], and it plays an important ecophysiological role [ 18] which depends on the concentration of these metabolites, whose synthesis is conditioned not only by environmental factors but also by an intrapopulation variation [ 17].
